intro: Chaetogastra strigillosa, commonly known as the hairy chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
